definition: (hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
waist/lower back/pocket/middle/loins

sentences.english: The dam backs up the water to prevent flood.
Up ahead appeared something like a sluice gate, straddling the tracks.
sentences.chinese: 前方出现了一个大水闸似的建筑，拦腰横跨在铁道上。

sentences.english: There They were hearing trees snap.
sentences.chinese: 他们听到树木被拦腰折断。

sentences.english: Throwing the links about his waist, it was but the work of a few seconds to secure it.
sentences.chinese: 不消一刹那工夫，就把他拦腰拴上链子了。

sentences.english: The dam cuts the river in the middle.
The body was weak, as if not careful it will break down the middle.
sentences.chinese: 那柔弱的身躯，仿佛不小心就会拦腰折断。

sentences.english: The car went out of control and ploughed into the side of a truck.
sentences.chinese: 小汽车失控拦腰撞在一辆卡车的侧面。

sentences.english: Dog carcass in alley this morning. Tire tread on burst stomach.
sentences.chinese: 早上小巷里出现狗的尸体，被轮胎拦腰碾过。

definition: to chop off
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
to snap sth off/to break
to cut off/to chop sth in half
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to skewer/to impale/to pierce through
to allow no explanation
to fall down
to cut off/to sever
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike
to split in two/to divide
to charge into
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
